name: leaders of national and regional governments

children.name: chancellor
children.definition: the leader of the government or the main government minister of some countries: thủ tướng (Áo, Đức)
examples: Helmut Kohl became the first Chancellor of a united Germany in 1990.
A former politician has been appointed Chancellor of the university.

children.name: Helmut Kohl, the former German Chancellor
the leadership
children.definition: the people in charge of a political party or country: lãnh đạo
examples: Party members had lost confidence in the leadership.
Turkey has lacked any clear leadership since the collapse of the coalition government four months ago.

children.name: the leadership of
examples: The leadership of the Association was criticized for not making its plans more easily accessible.

children.name: member of parliament
children.definition: (abbMP) sb who has been elected to a parliament, especially in UK or in a country that has a similar system of government, such as India, Australia, or South Africa: nghị sĩ
examples: There are still very few women members of parliament.
The conference will open with a speech by Barbara Morland, MP.
Labour/ Conservative/ Liberal MP (for)
the Labour MP for Birmingham South

children.name: president
children.definition: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen: tổng thống
examples: President Chirac visited Japan this week.
It was Dever’s job to advise the president on his public image.
[as form of address]Thank you, Mr/Madam President.
president of
the President of Egypt
presidential[attri adj] [B2]
a presidential election
the 2004 presidential campaign

vice president[C noun] (US written abbVP, US informalveep) the person who has the position immediately below the president in some countries, and who is responsible for the president's duties if he or she is unable to do them : phó tổng thống
presidency[C noun usually S] [B2] the position of being the president of a country or organization, or the period when sb is a president : chức vị tổng thống, nhiệm kì tổng thống
He has announced that he is running for the presidency.
Shewonthe presidency by a wide margin.
Roosevelt was elected four times to the presidency of the US.
There were few real improvements during his presidency.

children.name: head of state
children.definition: sb who leads a country or state: người đứng đầu nhà nước, bang
examples: President Clinton was the first head of state to sign the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty.
Twenty-one heads of state will meet at the annual World Trade summit.

children.name: prime minister
children.definition: (UK informal abbPM) the elected leader of the government in a country that has a parliament: thủ tướnng chính phủ
examples: The British Prime Minister lives at 10 Downing Street.
Hashimoto was elected prime minister in 1998.
The PM wants to see you.
prime minister of
the Prime Minister of India
premiership[C or U] the period when someone is Prime Minister , or the position of being Prime Minister : chức vị thủ tướng; nhiệm kỳ của một thủ tướng

children.name: ruler
children.definition: sb, such as a king or queen or a military leader, who has the power to run the government of a country: người cai trị, kẻ thống trị
examples: King Priam was a firm, but just ruler.
ruler of
Ramses II, ruler of Egypt in 13,000 BC
hereditary ruler[the son or daughter of a ruler, who becomes the new ruler when that parent dies] cha truyền con nối, kế vị
Some regimes are governed by hereditary rulers.

children.name: figurehead
children.definition: use this to describe sb who is recognized as the leader of a country or organization, although he or she does not have any real power: kẻ bù nhìn
examples: The president is essentially a figurehead: the real power lies with the prime minister.
He was never more than a mere figurehead in the negotiations.
